protein.specific_function: TRAP proteins are part of a complex whose function is to bind calcium to the ER membrane and thereby regulate the retention of ER resident proteins. May be involved in the recycling of the translocation apparatus after completion of the translocation process or may function as a membrane-bound chaperone facilitating folding of translocated proteins

reference.reference_text: Hartmann E, Prehn S: The N-terminal region of the alpha-subunit of the TRAP complex has a conserved cluster of negative charges. FEBS Lett. 1994 Aug 8;349(3):324-6.

Hirama T, Miller CW, Koeffler HP: Translocon-associated protein alpha transcripts are induced by granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor and exhibit complex alternative polyadenylation. FEBS Lett. 1999 Jul 23;455(3):223-7.
